vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
εὐλογ-έω,
imperfect εὐλόγουν or ηὐλ- [Refs 5th c.BC+]: future -ήσω [Refs 5th c.BC+]aorist εὐλόγησα or ηὐλ[LXX]: infinitive εὐλογῆσαι [Refs 5th c.BC+]: perfect εὐλόγηκα [LXX]passive, with future middle εὐλογήσομαι (variant -ηθήσομαι, as always in [LXX+5th c.BC+]: aorist εὐλογήθην [Refs 3rd c.BC+]: perfect εὐλόγημαι [LXX]:—speak well of, praise, πόλιν [Refs 5th c.BC+], Isoc.[same places]; deliver a panegyric upon, [Refs 4th c.BC+]: with neuter adjective, εὐ. καὶ δίκαια κἄδικα [Refs 5th c.BC+]; θεοὶ εὐλογοῦσί τινα honour him, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, ἐπαίνοις εὐλογούμενον πέδον [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II of God or men, [LXX+NT]perfect participle passive εὐλογημένος[LXX+NT]
__II.2 bless, praise a god, [Refs]; σου τὰς δυνάμεις[Refs]; so in [LXX+NT]
__II.3 also, apparently by a Hebrew euphemism, curse, [LXX]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to praise, give thanks to, speak well of, extol; (passive) to be blessed, receive blessing; in some contexts, to give a blessing is to act kindly and impart benefits to the one being blessed
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to praise, give thanks to, speak well of, extol; (passive) to be blessed, receive blessing; in some contexts, to give a blessing is to act kindly and impart benefits to the one being blessed
primarily to speak well of, in NT to bless, ascribe praise and glorification, Lk. 1:64; to bless, invoke a blessing upon, Mt. 5:44; to bless, confer a favor or blessing upon, Eph. 1:3; Heb. 6:14; passive to be blessed, to be an object of favor or blessing, Lk. 1:28
vocabInfos._es_Definition: bendecir, actuar con favor hacia (con Dios o Cristo como subj.) ; alabar (con Dios o Cristo como obj.) ; pedir ; la bendición de Dios sobre (la comida)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 稱頌, 讚美
2) 祝福
2a) 對神
2b) 對人
3) 施惠
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 称颂, 赞美
2) 祝福
2a) 对神
2b) 对人
3) 施惠
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: chúc lành; nói những lời tốt; được ban phước. εὖ (G2095) + λόγος (G3056)
